meanings.definition: To increase or add to in small, often regular amounts.
meanings.sent1: She incremented the number of books on the shelf by adding one every day.
meanings.sent2: The company incremented the price of their products by a small percentage.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel incrementing its acorn collection daily was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: His kindness towards others incremented his popularity among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden seemed to be incrementing in beauty with each passing day.

meanings.definition: The act of increasing or adding to in small, often regular amounts.
meanings.sent1: The increment of funds in the savings account was noticeable at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: She observed a steady increment in the number of visitors to the museum.
meanings.sent3: The increment of cupcakes at the party table made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The increment of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The increment of laughter in the room signaled a successful comedy show.
